comment: Professor McCoy is someone you want on your team. She is passionate about teaching and her students. I highly recommend her as a professor you should meet before graduating. At times she can be disorganized and her assignments may be ambiguous but thats just part of her charm, and well worth her stories and experience!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: She is the worst professor I've taken at KSU. She's unorganized and spends the entire class talking and telling stories about herself and her dinner parties. The assignments are unclear. The materials online for the hybrid class are a mess and the materials she uses are all from other professors.

If you are an education major, don't miss the opportunity to be influenced by Professor McCoy. She is both knowledgeable and passionate about teaching. She is good and clear with communicating assignments and expectations and is timely in providing grades and feedback. She has a real heart for her students and makes every effort be flexible.

Professor McCoy is a wonderful professor. She genuinely cares about your grades and wants you to succeed. She is very lenient with due dates which helps when you have a busy schedule, grading is very leniently although she tends to be a bit unclear with assignment and their due dates as she makes changes to the syllabus. You do not need the book!

Professor Mccoy is very funny and does everything for a reason. The main grade in 2110 is the field experience, she is strict on attire and professionalism because you are representing her and the university. A few reflection papers and a group history project and thats the entire class. She tells great stories and gives 2 tests the whole semester.

Ms McCoy can be a great professor at times. She really cares about the success of her students and makes it known that she cares. She is very lenient with due dates. She grades very leniently as well. Tends to be unclear with assignment due dates. She will change the syllabus often.

Wonderful lady who is very passionate about education. 2 quizzes throughout the semester with a very good review, show up and pass. Brought books to class for student's use and gave an online code for access to the book. Wants her students to succeed and learn, so very lenient on grades.

Assigned many assignments, however directions were not usually clear. She was willing to change due dates to accommodate students, and is very passionate and knowledgeable about what she does. However, did not really learn anything the class was about, just lectured about the same things everyday.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She is very disorganized, but she is a good person and grades you easy. Great professor.

Loved this woman. She was such an easy professor. Only assignments is 2 quizzes and she gives you the answers, and the assignments that you do about your field experience (15 hours). Would definitely recommend taking her.

She gives way to many assignments but does not explain any of them. She talks so much in class but you never learn anything important in her class. You have to participate in her class for a good grade. The one good thing  is that she grades really easily.

I have to admit, Mrs. McCoy is a great teacher, but if you do not handle someone talking down to you or someone not treating you like an adult, then she is not the teacher for you. She is super easy; a module due each week. The Field Experience is easy and so are the assignments. We only had 2 quizzes and did not take final!

Professor McCoy was a good professor. Class was easy, my only complaint if she changes her calendar EVERY CLASS to accommodate the students so it's bittersweet. Overall one of the easiest A's I've ever received as it is mainly based on your field experience. Would recommend!!!

This class was super easy with McCoy, she changes due dates, and even though she says that the online work is due at a certain time, if you email her, she will usually extend it. Although she is not very clear on what she expects in the homework, if you participate, and at least try, then you will do fine. It was an easy A.

She genuinely cares about the well-being of her students, but her class is so disorganized. Her due dates were never clear. You would miss a due date and she would say that she discussed it in class, but she just rambles the whole class.  Her syllabus is the most unclear thing ever. Just do the work and you'll get an A but you won't learn anything.
Awesome teacher. I'd take a class with her anytime

Assignments and grade-wise, easy class. However, because she likes to change the schedule and due dates for the convenience of the students, things often get muddled and you don't really know what's going on. If you need help, she pushes you to ask several others before she'll even hear you out.

I love McCoy! The 1st week I was in tears because I was so stressed, but after I figured her out, she's great. Although she's disorganized and confusing at times, she really cares about her students. Very flexible with due dates of papersonline modules, which is so helpful. Hardly lectures, lots of class discussion! Take her!! Easy A!

I didn't learn a thing in this class other than what color I am in the professional world and how to dress classy. We had a paper on philosophy and the word "philosophy" never came out of her mouth. She will discuss the schedule for about 45 minutes at the beginning of each class. EVEN THE LAST DAY!!

I constantly left this class wanting to cry every single time. She is the MOST confusing professor I have ever taken. Yeah, she's pretty easy, but literally I stressed out most of the semester because I never knew what was due the next class. The only reason I passed this class was because of my classmates. DO NOT TAKE HER.

She is a nice person most of the time, but the class is EXTREMELY disorganized. She rambles a lot, and very little of it is helpful. The assignments and projects are informative.  She goes over the quizzes before she gives them, but may or may not give you the right answers to the questions. Unless you enjoy bi-weekly frustration, avoid.

She is great!She speaks about real-life situations, and she moves the dates around to accommodate to student's schedules that have been overloaded. i.e. She moved many of our assignment due dates around because of the snow storm, which was kind of her.  I wish she taught upper level education classes because I definitely would take her again!

Ms. McCoy is a very nice professor. She is sometimes not 100% clear on dates as she moves them around often but that is only to help students. She gives great advice from her own experiences teaching. Overall, I learned a lot from McCoy. I would take her again. Plus easiest A I've ever gotten.
Good teacher, changes around the schedule and moves assignments around to whatever works best with the class.

This teacher may be the most unorganized teacher I know. She is very confusing and I would never her class again. She has a lot of experience, therefore, she likes to talk about how great she is constantly. She makes the class a lot more confusing than it should be. I would take anyone but her.

This class was very easy but McCoy is a terrible professor! She is very unclear when it comes to what she expects for assignments. She is the most disorganized professor I have ever had. She can also be very disrespectful at times towards students. Happy with my grade but I would never take a class with her again. Find anyone else!

She is very scatterbrained and doesn't stay on topic during class time at all. She expects you to print out anything that you've done online and bring it to class. Easy class, but she makes it more difficult than it needs to be. I feel like if you're an education teacher- you need to practice what you preach. She does not meet this standard.

Found this class really boring and not very helpful. The students teach the class with presentations. I do not recommend her because she was very unclear about her expectations and basically, it felt like she didn't want to teach and talked a lot taking up students presentation time.

She is obviously very knowledgeable and has a lot of life experiences that she likes to talk about in class. Sometimes she can get off topic and I will walk out of class saying "what were supposed to be learning today?". Overall, however, she is a good teacher. Easy A as long as you show up and do all of the assignments.

I had Ms. McCoy for EDUC 2130 and currently have her for EDMG 3300. She is one of my favorite teachers in the College of Education. She is full of experience and very flexible with deadlines. I would recommend her to anyone. Be ready to be pushed out of your comfort zone if you do not like speaking in front of the class!

Very helpful and full of working experience! This is a teacher that want to get you ready for the future. Uses technology when possible and always has an encouraging word. Her class is a lot of written work, but get use to it if you are and Education major!

She is a sweet person. She is very informative of current articles about education.  She assigns fair amount of work.  Some of it was group work. She is flexible with assignments deadlines.  Some students were upset about the way she taught bc they felt like she got off topic and was too flexible with due dates...I got an A in this class.
Very kind and understanding, a little too much so.  But helps students out and wants everybody to do well.  Very committed. Hard to understand what assignments are due and when, and how.

Ms. McCoy was such a great teacher. I had her last year and I always enjoyed going to her class. There were a lot of assignments but she was very understanding and her due dates were flexible. She is a fun teacher who is always upbeat and fun to be around. If I could have taken all of my education classes with Ms. McCoy I would have.

Professor McCoy is absolutely amazing! She is helpful, makes herself available to her students, and is really honest about the field of education. There are a lot of assignments, but they all help you learn a lot and are very simple. Attendance is mandatory but class is always interesting and fun. Take her if you can!

She is so kind and understanding. Some students in the class made it seem as if the work was difficult, but as long as you followed the directions to the best of your ability she'll give you an A! She gets off topic A LOT but she gives useful info! TAKE HER! She's very knowlegable!

She is a very nice lady and sympathizes with her students. There were modules due almost every week, 5 Field Exp. (2 pages double spaced)and a presentation. Those were the major assignments and as long as you do a good job on those you will be fine. I would take her class again.

Very unclear about when assignments are due and how you are supposed to complete them, but she is a very understanding professor. Almost all of her students get frustrated with her because she tends to do a lot of pointless stuff in class while leaving us a ton of stuff to do at home. No tests or quizzes but plenty of work and presentations.

Professor McCoy is a pretty fair professor. She requires participation in her class, so expect to be called on a lot in class but she is also understanding and won't embarrass you. The class had a lot of busy work, but it was all fairly easy to do. I would take her again, she is an interesting and understanding person.
